# 7-segment display blueprint book
# Authors: Keombre, Lactosis
# Usage: put down starter blueprint, then extend as far as you want with tiles by building them over each other.
# Build the first tile over the starter.
# Do not put starter multiple times.
# DO NOT OVERWRITE THE CIRCUIT CONDITIONS!
# You can tweak the color of ligths on constant combinator in starter blueprint. 
# Just set the colored output to another color.
# If you want you can change the base in which this display outputs numbers by changing the value of S.
# By default S=10, which is equivalent to decimal display (base 10)
# If you want to change the way the numbers display, create appropriate numbers J,K,L,M,N,O,P for each segment.
# Default values that can display any base up to 16, are: 
#	J = 0b1101011111101101 	= 55277 = upper
#	K = 0b0010011110011111	= 10143 = upper-right
#	L = 0b0010111111111011	= 12283 = lower-right
#	M = 0b0111101101101101	= 31597 = lower
#	N = 0b1111110101000101	= 64837 = lower-left
#	O = 0b1101111101110001	= 57201 = upper-left
#	P = 0b1110111101111100	= 61308 = middle
# Columns here are the digits of the base. For example first column represents digit F in base 16, while last column represents 0.
# Maximum number of symbols you can display with this is 60.
